channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3004] Your Sex Life Vs. My Sex Life [comic]
[+2977] The Ungooglable Man
[+2374] Calvin & Hobbes On War
item.description: Seems a little bit futile, doesn't it?

item.title: [+2101] Digg: The Digg iFrame Toolbar is Dead / Unbanning Domains
item.description: Here are a couple updates regarding the DiggBar (iFrame toolbar) and banned sites. Note: These changes will not take place until the launch of Digg v4, sign up for the beta now.

item.title: [+1854] Apple Store Goes On Lockdown When You Try To Buy A MacBook
item.description: What would you think if this happened to you? Owen JJ Stone walked into the Apple Store to get a laptop, and when he asked for a specific model, security went on lockdown. People were touching their ears, saying code words, and blocking the exits.

item.title: [+1781] US court rules against FCC on `net neutrality'
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) -- A federal appeals court has ruled that the Federal Communications Commission lacks the authority to require broadband providers to give equal treatment to all Internet traffic flowing over their networks.

item.title: [+1561] Breaking: Right Wing Begins Internet Attacks
item.description: Following a coordinated window smashing campaign by angry conservatives following the historic passing of health care reform, the attacks have now moved to cyberspace. Various websites critical of the Tea Parties, Sarah Palin, and the right wing reaction to health care reform have begun experiencing DDOS attacks by hackers.

item.title: [+1455] Drugged Girl Tripping After Wisdom Teeth Removal (Video)
item.description: You know what they say: novocaine is a hell of a drug.

item.title: [+1443] Pope Vows To Get Church Pedophilia Down To Acceptable Levels
item.description: VATICAN CITY Calling the behavior shameful, sinful, and much more frequent than the Vatican was comfortable with, Pope Benedict XVI vowed this week to bring the widespread pedophilia within the Roman Catholic Church down to a more manageable level.

item.title: [+1253] What Stormtroopers Do On Their Day Off (Pics)
item.description: 365 photographs later, Stéfan has finally finished his year long project of photographing Stormtroopers in various daily scenarios. In this part two follow-up post (Part 1), we show some of the most popular photos from his second half of the TK455 & TK479 journey!

item.title: [+1113] If This Van's A-Rockin'... Call 911 (PIC)
[+1057] If Child's Drawings Were Painted Realistically... (pics)
[+918] Why Microsoft did the right thing in ditching XP for IE9
item.description: Users of Windows XP were alarmed when Microsoft confirmed that IE9 would not be available for their chosen platform. Microsoft said that a modern browser needs a modern operating system. Is Windows XP really not modern any more?

item.title: [+823] 5 Ways to Start Investing with $1,000 or Less
item.description: Too many people – particularly young ones – wait too long to start investing. Their excuse? “I don’t have enough money.” The truth is, even if you only have $1,000 to spare, becoming an investor today is the best move you can make because it puts the power of interest compounding in your favor.

item.title: [+804] Study Sheds Light on What Makes People Shy
item.description: The brains of shy or introverted individuals might process the world differently than extroverts

item.title: [+781] BREAKING : Magnitude 7.8 quake shakes Indonesia
item.description: A major earthquake of magnitude 7.8 shook the Indonesian island of Sumatra, the U.S. Geological Survey said.

item.title: [+680] Apple iPhone OS 4 Revealed on April 8
item.description: Apple's just sent an invite "for a sneak peek of the next generation of iPhone OS software" on April 8 at 10AM Pacific. That's in three days! We'll be there. Start your predictions now.

item.title: [+640] Earthquake lifts a layer of dust off a mountain range (PIC)
item.description: Brothers traveling during Sunday's quake photograph a surreal sight.

item.title: [+600] Is It Okay To Download A Pirated Copy Of A Book You Own?
item.description: Yesterday we wrote about someone who downloaded a pirated copy of a game after he couldn't gain access to the copy he'd already paid for. In that case, which most of our commenters supported... But what about if you own a printed copy of a book and you simply want to read the ebook version?

item.title: [+596] A Long Time Ago In A Banana Stand Far, Far Away... (pic)
